title: UK PM's Office Apologises After Outrage Over Non-Veg Food At Diwali Party
content: Prime Minister Keir Starmer's office on Friday apologised for a "mistake" in the organisation of its Diwali reception at 10 Downing Street after some British Hindus objected to non-vegetarian food and alcohol being served at the gathering.
summary: Prime Minister Keir Starmer's office on Friday apologised for a "mistake" in the organisation of its Diwali reception at 10 Downing Street after some British Hindus objected to non-vegetarian food and alcohol being served at the gathering.

title: 2 Drunk Soldiers Caught Having Sex Inside Rs 75 Crore Military Chopper In UK
content: Noticing the rotors of an Apache helicopter making unusual movements at a military training area in the UK, maintenance staff decided to check and were surprised to find two soldiers having sex inside.
summary: Noticing the rotors of an Apache helicopter making unusual movements at a military training area in the UK, maintenance staff decided to check and were surprised to find two soldiers having sex inside.

title: "Audible Gasps" As Trump Picks Loyalists Over Qualified For Top Posts
content: The structure of Trump 2.0 White House has left leaders "stunned" and "appalled", with some of his choices even rubbing Republicans the wrong way.
summary: The structure of Trump 2.0 White House has left leaders "stunned" and "appalled", with some of his choices even rubbing Republicans the wrong way.

title: Opinion: Will Trump Try To Unite America? What His Nominations Tell Us
content: If you're looking for an insight that helps explain what happened in the US election and why it happened, consider this observation from a key player in US politics: "There is a difference between what offends people and what affects them."

title: Meet Anura Kumara Dissanayake, Sri Lanka's New President

title: Saudi Minister Cites India's Efforts In Fighting Land Degradation, Drought
content: As Saudi capital Riyadh gets ready to host the Conference of the Parties (COP16) of the United Nations Convention to Combat Desertification (UNCCD), Dr Osama Faqeeha, Deputy Minister of Environment, Water and Agriculture, has praised India's efforts.
summary: As Saudi capital Riyadh gets ready to host the Conference of the Parties (COP16) of the United Nations Convention to Combat Desertification (UNCCD), Dr Osama Faqeeha, Deputy Minister of Environment, Water and Agriculture, has praised India's efforts.

title: More Than 80% Of Indians Exposed To Climate-Related Health Risks
content: Almost everyone in India is now vulnerable to the impacts of climate change, former chief scientist of the World Health Organisation Dr Soumya Swaminathan has said.
summary: Almost everyone in India is now vulnerable to the impacts of climate change, former chief scientist of the World Health Organisation Dr Soumya Swaminathan has said.

title: Demand For Abortion Pill Requests Soars In US After Trump Win
content: Aid Access, the leading supplier of abortion pills by mail in the US, received over 5,000 requests in less than 12 hours.
summary: Aid Access, the leading supplier of abortion pills by mail in the US, received over 5,000 requests in less than 12 hours.

title: Elon Musk Escalates Legal Feud With Sam Altman, Alleges OpenAI A "Monopolist"
content: Musk said in the filing that the company "has attempted to starve competitors of AI talent by aggressively recruiting employees with offers of lavish compensation and is on track to spend $1.5 billion on personnel for just 1,500 employees."
summary: Musk said in the filing that the company "has attempted to starve competitors of AI talent by aggressively recruiting employees with offers of lavish compensation and is on track to spend $1.5 billion on personnel for just 1,500 employees."

title: Five Under-The-Radar Travel Destinations The UN Says You Should Visit
content: 55 small, rural escapes around the world, earned a spot in the 2024 edition of UN Tourisms "Best Tourism Villages."

title: Passengers To See 2 Sunrises On World's Longest Flight Taking Off In 2026
content: Passengers will experience two sunrises on this record-breaking journey, made possible by specially designed Airbus A350 aircraft.

title: Brother Of Late Harrods Owner Accused Of Sexual Violence: Report
content: Three women formerly employed by Harrods have accused the brother of its late boss Mohamed Al-Fayed of sexual violence.

title: Nearly 260 Million Americans Will Be Overweight Or Obese By 2050: Study
content: The US overweight and obese population will rise significantly in the next quarter century if current trends continue, and new weight-loss treatments wont be sufficient to stem the tide, researchers said.
summary: The US overweight and obese population will rise significantly in the next quarter century if current trends continue, and new weight-loss treatments wont be sufficient to stem the tide, researchers said.

title: Donald Trump Determined To Get "Wokeness" Out Of Education
content: Donald Trump's vision for education revolves around a single goal: to rid America's schools of perceived "wokeness" and "left-wing indoctrination".
summary: Donald Trump's vision for education revolves around a single goal: to rid America's schools of perceived "wokeness" and "left-wing indoctrination".

title: China's Robot Wolves Can Jump, Climb, Back-Flip Through Difficult Terrains
content: Unlike its predecessors, the four-legged Lynx robot moves around on all-terrain wheels instead of solid feet
summary: Unlike its predecessors, the four-legged Lynx robot moves around on all-terrain wheels instead of solid feet

title: NASA-Microsoft's New Earth Copilot To Enhance Understanding On Our Planet
content: US space agency NASA has partnered with Microsoft to develop an easier-to-access and user-friendly Artificial Intelligence-based chatbot that can help people decode scientific data about Earth.

title: Trump 2.0 "Won't Slow" Climate Progress "Much": Former US Vice President

title: India, China Ministers To Meet, 1st High-Level Talks Post Disengagement
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh will meet Chinese counterpart Dong Jun - the first ministerial-level meeting since the two militaries disengaged in eastern Ladakh last month and India resumed patrolling in Depsang last week.
summary: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh will meet Chinese counterpart Dong Jun - the first ministerial-level meeting since the two militaries disengaged in eastern Ladakh last month and India resumed patrolling in Depsang last week.

title: Pregnancy-Associated Cancers On The Rise. What Researchers Say About It
content: Cancer diagnoses during pregnancy and in the year following the birth are rare. But such cases are becoming more common in parts of the world.

title: Wars, Trump Presidency To Dominate G20 Summit In Brazil
content: The G20 summit is set to be dominated by differences over wars in the Middle East and Ukraine, and the implications of Donald Trump's White House return.
